China's Dec new home prices fall at fastest pace since Feb 2015China's December new home prices fell at the fastest pace since February 2015, marking the sixth straight month of declines, official data showed on Wednesday, with the sector still struggling to get back on its feet due to weak confidence. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 01:41:45 GMT JCEBHBKJ65MT3KA7WTDXCN65T4 https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinas-dec-new-home-prices-fall-fastest-pace-since-feb-2015-2024-01-17/Reuters市场宏观问题
China to support Togo in safeguarding its sovereignty, security -Wang YiChina will continue to firmly support Togo in safeguarding its sovereignty, security and development interests, China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said while visiting the African country, according to a ministry statement on Wednesday. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 01:16:16 GMT E6ZVQWPZ6FLF7OQSWZX776U7G4 https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/china-support-togo-safeguarding-its-sovereignty-security-wang-yi-2024-01-17/Reuters世界亚太地区
China's Q4 GDP to show patchy economic recovery, many challenges aheadChina's economy likely perked up slightly in the fourth quarter, enabling the government to hit its growth target after the previous year's miss, but the outlook for 2024 remains shaky amid a protracted property slump and weak consumer confidence. Tue, 16 Jan 2024 23:04:35 GMT DU5CWCOSLZK6ZCJR3WIVXXNSCM https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/chinas-q4-gdp-show-patchy-economic-recovery-many-challenges-ahead-2024-01-16/Kevin Yao市场亚洲市场

Canada clamps down on researchers with ties to China, Iran, RussiaCanada on Tuesday clamped down on researchers affiliated with a list of mainly China-based universities to stop them working on subjects deemed sensitive or critical to Canadian national security. Saudi Arabia has not yet joined BRICs - ministerSaudi Arabia has not yet officially joined the BRICs bloc of developing countries, the kingdom's minister of commerce said in a panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos on Tuesday.
